subject: NCAA Basketball Tournament
lead_paragraph: Derrick Rose, a freshman guard, scored 21 points last night to help third-ranked Memphis beat visiting Richmond, 80-63, in its second-round game of the 2K Sports College Hoops Classic.In a first-round game, Joe Crawford scored 20 points and No. 2o Kentucky began the Billy Gillispie era with a 67-40 victory against visiting Central Arkansas. Kentucky (1-0) plays its second-round game tonight against Gardner-Webb, which defeated Alabama A&M, 69-55.Gillispie led Texas A&M to the Round of 16 at last season’s N.C.A.A. tournament before replacing Tubby Smith.Memphis (2-0) won after trailing with less than 13 minutes to play. Rose was named most valuable player of the Memphis regional, scoring 38 points in two rounds of the tournament that benefits Coaches vs. Cancer.David Gonzalez had 25 points for Richmond (1-1), including the first 9 points of the second half.Chris Douglas-Roberts added 19 points and 9 rebounds for Memphis.For Kentucky, Crawford shot 7 of 11 from the field and Mark Coury scored 10 of Kentucky’s first 12 points. Coury finished with 13 points and 10 rebounds.Durrell Nevels had 10 points to lead Central Arkansas (0-1), which missed its first nine shots; its first field goal came more than six minutes in.
